intro: Conyza foetida, commonly known as stinking weed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it has a distinctive, strong odor. Conyza foetida is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural areas. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its seeds are dispersed by wind.
